attributes.action: Elected members of Conservative party should step down.
attributes.additional_details: If the majority held by the current conservative government can be reduced by individuals stepping down then an election can be forced, it is the only way the public can have a say in what is currently happening in parliament.
attributes.background: With the fiasco that is our current government and the inability of the country to enforce its democratic right to consultation it is only fair to force a general election.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions that relate to honours or appointments. This includes petitions calling for someone to lose their job.

In any case, any decision to stand down as an MP is an individual matter for that MP and their party, not the Government or House of Commons as a whole.

You might like to sign this petition which calls for a related action:

Change the law so that UK citizens can call a General election: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/618068
